documentation.text: @notice Order status enumeration for better tracking and logic handling
@notice Struct to hold the order data
@notice Counter to generate unique order IDs
@notice Event emitted whenever an order is updated

devdoc.author: YourName
devdoc.details: All function calls are currently implemented without side effects

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

acceptOrder(address,address,address,uint.details: Only callable by the contract owner

returns._0: uint256 The newly generated Order ID

cancelOrder(uint256).details: Only callable by the contract owner

returns.token: The ERC20 token address used for the payment

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

releaseFunds(uint256).details: Only callable by the contract owner

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: CengliP2PEscrow - Peer to peer escrow contract for Cengli

OrderUpdated(uint256,uint8).notice: Event emitted whenever an order is updated

acceptOrder(address,address,address,uint.notice: Accepts a new order or updates an existing one

getOrder(uint256).notice: Fetches the details of an order

orderIdCounter().notice: Counter to generate unique order IDs

releaseFunds(uint256).notice: Releases the escrowed funds to the buyer

userdoc.notice: This contract facilitates a P2P exchange between a buyer and a partner.
